oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of factory power loom
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This indoor scene shows an enormous industrial loom. Munitions manufacturing ceased at the Old Hickory site after WWI, but DuPont built another plant for the manufacture of a cheaper newly invented textile that mimicked silk by 1929. Rayon is a spun polyesterbond fabric. Reemay was also made at the facility. In the postwar era, portions of Old Hickory became known as Rayon City. The Old Hickory Gunpowder Plant had produced smokeless gunpowder during World War I and was the largest in the world.
